Rule Description: Navigation must include a CTA button (Sign Up/Get Started) that visually stands out from regular nav links
Violation Example: Nav has only text links, no prominent CTA button
Fix Suggestion: Add a CTA button with contrasting color (e.g., bg-blue-600 text-white) to the right side of the navbar

Rule Description: Landing page must have a Hero section with headline, subheadline, and at least one CTA button
Violation Example: Page starts directly with features or content without a hero section
Fix Suggestion: Add a Hero section (min-h-[60vh]) with H1 headline, supporting subheadline, and primary CTA button

Rule Description: Landing page must have a Footer with organized links, legal info, and copyright
Violation Example: Page ends without a footer section
Fix Suggestion: Add a Footer with columns: Product, Company, Resources, Legal. Include copyright, privacy/terms links, and social icons

Rule Description: Landing page must have at least 2 CTA placements (hero + bottom/mid-page)
Violation Example: Only one CTA button exists on the entire page (in hero only)
Fix Suggestion: Add a secondary CTA section after testimonials or features. Repeat the primary CTA with slightly different messaging

Rule Description: Landing page must clearly communicate the value proposition within the hero or immediately after
Violation Example: No clear value proposition statement visible above the fold
Fix Suggestion: Add a concise value proposition: what the product does, for whom, and the key benefit. Place in or right after hero

Rule Description: Landing page must have a Features section showcasing 3-6 key product features
Violation Example: No features section or features not clearly presented
Fix Suggestion: Add a Features section with 3-6 feature cards, each with icon, title, and short description

Rule Description: Landing page should have social proof (testimonials, logos, user count, or reviews)
Violation Example: No testimonials, partner logos, user statistics, or reviews anywhere on the page
Fix Suggestion: Add at least one social proof element: customer testimonials, company logos, user count badge, or ratings

Rule Description: Landing page should have a FAQ section addressing common questions
Violation Example: No FAQ section on the landing page
Fix Suggestion: Add an FAQ section with 5-8 common questions using an accordion/collapsible pattern

Rule Description: Sign Up page must include a link to Sign In for existing users
Violation Example: Sign Up page has no mention of Sign In or link for existing users
Fix Suggestion: Add text below form: 'Already have an account? Sign in' with link to /signin

Rule Description: Sign Up page should offer OAuth/social login options (Google, GitHub, etc.)
Violation Example: Only email/password registration available, no social login buttons
Fix Suggestion: Add OAuth buttons above the form with visual separator. Minimum: Google. Optional: GitHub, Apple

Rule Description: Sign Up page must include Terms of Service and Privacy Policy acceptance
Violation Example: No terms/privacy checkbox or text near the submit button
Fix Suggestion: Add checkbox or implicit consent text: 'By signing up, you agree to our Terms and Privacy Policy' with links

Rule Description: Sign In page must include a link to Sign Up for new users
Violation Example: Sign In page has no mention of Sign Up or link for new users
Fix Suggestion: Add text below form: 'Don't have an account? Sign up for free' with link to /signup

Rule Description: Sign In page must include a Forgot Password link near the password field
Violation Example: No forgot password link or recovery option on the Sign In page
Fix Suggestion: Add 'Forgot password?' link near/below the password field, linking to /forgot-password

Rule Description: Sign In page should offer same OAuth options as Sign Up page
Violation Example: Sign In has email/password only while Sign Up has Google/GitHub login
Fix Suggestion: Add same OAuth buttons as Sign Up page for consistency

Rule Description: Dashboard must have either sidebar navigation or top navigation bar with app sections
Violation Example: Dashboard page has no persistent navigation, only content
Fix Suggestion: Add sidebar (w-64, full height) OR top navigation bar with links to all app sections

Rule Description: Dashboard must have a user menu with avatar, showing at minimum Profile, Settings, and Logout
Violation Example: No user avatar, dropdown, or logout button visible in the dashboard
Fix Suggestion: Add user avatar/name in nav with dropdown menu containing: Profile, Settings, divider, Log out

Rule Description: Dashboard should have a stats/overview section with key metrics
Violation Example: Dashboard opens to empty content or just a list without summary metrics
Fix Suggestion: Add 2-4 stat cards at the top showing key metrics (total users, revenue, active projects, etc.)

Rule Description: Dashboard must show proper empty states when there is no data (not blank space)
Violation Example: Lists/tables show blank white space when no data exists
Fix Suggestion: Add empty state components: illustration + message + CTA button for each empty data section

Rule Description: Pricing page must have 2-4 plan comparison cards with features and CTAs
Violation Example: No pricing cards or only a text list of prices
Fix Suggestion: Add 2-4 plan cards with: plan name, price, billing period, feature list, CTA button. Highlight recommended plan

Rule Description: Pricing page must have a FAQ section addressing common billing/pricing questions
Violation Example: No FAQ section on pricing page
Fix Suggestion: Add FAQ section with questions about: refunds, plan changes, billing cycle, team pricing, enterprise options

Rule Description: Pricing page should have a feature comparison table below plan cards
Violation Example: Only plan cards with short feature lists, no detailed comparison
Fix Suggestion: Add a full feature comparison table showing all features across all plans with checkmarks/crosses

Rule Description: Pricing page must visually highlight the recommended/popular plan
Violation Example: All plan cards look identical, none is highlighted as recommended
Fix Suggestion: Add 'Most Popular' or 'Recommended' badge to mid-tier plan. Use different border color or subtle background

Rule Description: Blog posts must show author name and publication date
Violation Example: Blog post has no author attribution or date
Fix Suggestion: Add author name (with avatar optional) and date below the title. Format: 'By Author Name Â· Month Day, Year'

Rule Description: Blog posts should have social sharing buttons
Violation Example: No way to share the blog post on social media
Fix Suggestion: Add share buttons (Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Copy link) either below title or as floating sidebar

Rule Description: Blog posts must use proper heading hierarchy (H1 title, H2 sections, H3 subsections)
Violation Example: Blog post skips from H1 to H3, or uses multiple H1s, or uses bold text instead of headings
Fix Suggestion: Restructure headings: single H1 for title, H2 for major sections, H3 for subsections. Never skip levels

Rule Description: Blog list page must have pagination or infinite scroll for many posts
Violation Example: All posts shown on single page without pagination, causing slow load
Fix Suggestion: Add pagination with Previous/Next buttons and page numbers. Show 10-15 posts per page

Rule Description: Product detail page must have a prominent Add to Cart button
Violation Example: No clear add to cart or purchase button on product page
Fix Suggestion: Add large, prominent 'Add to Cart' button near the price. Use brand color, full-width on mobile

Rule Description: Product detail page must have multiple product images or image gallery
Violation Example: Only single product image or no images at all
Fix Suggestion: Add image gallery with 3-5 product photos from different angles. Support zoom and lightbox

Rule Description: Product detail page should have breadcrumb navigation
Violation Example: No breadcrumbs showing product hierarchy (Home > Category > Product)
Fix Suggestion: Add breadcrumbs: Home > Category > Subcategory > Product Name with proper links

Rule Description: Checkout page must show order summary with items, quantities, and total
Violation Example: Checkout shows payment form but no summary of what user is purchasing
Fix Suggestion: Add order summary section showing: item names, quantities, unit prices, subtotal, tax, shipping, total

Rule Description: Checkout page should display trust indicators (SSL, money-back, payment logos)
Violation Example: No trust indicators near payment information
Fix Suggestion: Add trust badges: SSL secure, money-back guarantee, accepted payment method logos near payment form

Rule Description: Checkout page should have minimal navigation to prevent abandonment
Violation Example: Checkout has full site navigation, tempting users to leave
Fix Suggestion: Remove main navigation. Show only: logo + progress steps. Add 'Back to cart' link only

Rule Description: All page sections must use the same max-width container (e.g., max-w-7xl)
Violation Example: Hero uses max-w-5xl while features use max-w-7xl and footer uses max-w-6xl
Fix Suggestion: Standardize to one max-width (recommended: max-w-7xl) across all sections. Use the same container class

Rule Description: All pages must be responsive at standard breakpoints (375px, 768px, 1024px, 1440px)
Violation Example: Page layout breaks on mobile: overlapping elements, horizontal scroll, tiny text
Fix Suggestion: Add responsive classes: grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3. Test at all standard breakpoints

Rule Description: All page sections must use consistent vertical spacing (e.g., py-16 md:py-24)
Violation Example: Sections have random spacing: py-8 then py-24 then py-4
Fix Suggestion: Standardize section spacing to py-16 md:py-24 for all sections. Use py-20 md:py-32 for hero only

Rule Description: Use SVG icons from a consistent icon set, never emojis as UI icons
Violation Example: Emojis used as feature icons: rocket emoji for speed, gear emoji for settings
Fix Suggestion: Replace all emojis with SVG icons from Lucide, Heroicons, or another consistent icon set

Rule Description: All clickable elements must have cursor-pointer class
Violation Example: Cards, buttons, and links missing cursor-pointer, showing default cursor on hover
Fix Suggestion: Add cursor-pointer class to all interactive elements: buttons, links, clickable cards, toggles

Rule Description: Every page must have a unique, descriptive title tag
Violation Example: Page has no <title> tag or uses generic 'Untitled' or same title on all pages
Fix Suggestion: Add unique <title> following format: 'Page Name - Product Name'. Keep under 60 characters

Rule Description: Every indexable page must have a unique meta description
Violation Example: Page has no meta description or uses the same description on all pages
Fix Suggestion: Add <meta name='description'> with unique 150-160 character description including primary keyword

Rule Description: Every public page should have Open Graph image for social sharing
Violation Example: No og:image meta tag, social shares show no preview image
Fix Suggestion: Add <meta property='og:image'> with 1200x630px image. Create a default OG image template for pages without custom images

Rule Description: Every indexable page must have a canonical URL tag
Violation Example: No canonical tag, risking duplicate content issues
Fix Suggestion: Add <link rel='canonical' href='https://example.com/current-page' /> to every indexable page

Rule Description: Every page must have exactly one H1 tag
Violation Example: Page has zero H1 tags, or multiple H1 tags
Fix Suggestion: Ensure exactly one H1 per page. H1 should be the main page title/headline. Use H2-H4 for subsections

Rule Description: All pages should have a 'Skip to main content' accessibility link
Violation Example: No skip navigation link for keyboard users
Fix Suggestion: Add visually hidden skip link as first focusable element: Skip to main content

Rule Description: Navigation must show active/current page indicator
Violation Example: All nav links look the same, user cannot tell which page they are on
Fix Suggestion: Add active state styling to current page's nav link: different color, font-weight, border-bottom, or background
